verses.verse: (Complaint about a Friend’s Treachery) To the leader: with stringed instruments. A Maskil of David. (Ps 27.9; 61.1) Give ear to my prayer, O God; do not hide yourself from my supplication.
(Ps 66.19; 77.3; Isa 38.14) Attend to me and answer me; I am troubled in my complaint. I am distraught

(2 Sam 16.7, 8; Ps 17.9; 71.11) by the noise of the enemy, because of the clamor of the wicked. For they bring (Cn Compare Gk: Heb they cause to totter) trouble upon me, and in anger they bear a grudge against me.
(Ps 116.3) My heart is in anguish within me; the terrors of death have fallen upon me.
(Job 21.6; Ps 119.120) Fear and trembling come upon me, and horror overwhelms me.
(Job 3.13) And I say, “O that I had wings like a dove! I would fly away and be at rest;
truly, I would flee far away; I would lodge in the wilderness; Selah
(Isa 4.6) I would hurry to find a shelter for myself from the raging wind and tempest.”
(Jer 6.7) Confuse, O Lord, confound their speech, for I see violence and strife in the city.
Day and night they go around it on its walls, and iniquity and trouble are within it;
(Ps 5.9; 10.7) ruin is in its midst; oppression and fraud do not depart from its marketplace.
(Ps 41.9) It is not enemies who taunt me— I could bear that; it is not adversaries who deal insolently with me— I could hide from them.
(2 Sam 15.12; Jer 9.4) But it is you, my equal, my companion, my familiar friend,
(Ps 42.4) with whom I kept pleasant company; we walked in the house of God with the throng.
(Num 16.30, 33; Ps 64.7) Let death come upon them; let them go down alive to Sheol, for evil is in their homes and in their hearts.
(Ps 57.2, 3) But I call upon God, and the LORD will save me.
(Ps 141.2; Dan 6.10) Evening and morning and at noon I utter my complaint and moan, and he will hear my voice.
(2 Chr 32.7, 8; Ps 103.4) He will redeem me unharmed from the battle that I wage, for many are arrayed against me.
(Deut 33.27; Ps 78.59) God, who is enthroned from of old, Selah will hear and will humble them, because they do not change and do not fear God.
(Ps 7.4; 89.34) My companion laid hands on a friend and violated a covenant with me (Heb lacks with me)
(Ps 59.7; Prov 5.3) with speech smoother than butter but with a heart set on war, with words that were softer than oil but in fact were drawn swords.
(Ps 37.24; Mt 6.25) Cast your burden (Or Cast what he has given you) on the LORD, and he will sustain you; he will never permit the righteous to be moved.
(Job 15.32; Ps 5.6; 73.18) But you, O God, will cast them down into the lowest pit; the bloodthirsty and treacherous shall not live out half their days. But I will trust in you.
